prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times its diameter. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) with center at (0.375, 0.375) and radius 0.375 on the XY plane. This forms loop\\_1 on face\\_1 of the 2D sketch. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using identity euler angles and translation vector 0, 0, 0. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction, creating a new solid body with the extrusion depth set to "NewBodyFeatureOperation." Part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, and translation vector -0.0562, -0.0562, 0.5. 2. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw the first circle (circle\\_1) with center at (0.4312, 0.4312) and radius 0.4312 on the XY plane. This forms loop\\_1 on face\\_1 of the 2D sketch. 4. Draw the second circle (circle\\_1) with center at (0.4312, 0.4312) and radius 0.375 on the XY plane. This forms loop\\_2 on face\\_1 of the 2D sketch. 5. Draw the third circle (circle\\_1) with center at (0.4312, 0.4312) and radius 0.305 on the XY plane. This forms loop\\_2 on face\\_2 of the 2D sketch. 6. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.8625. 7. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using identity euler angles and translation vector 0, 0, 0. 8. Perform a cut extrusion with 0.0 depth in the positive normal direction and 0.375 depth in the opposite direction. This will result in a tapered middle section. Part 3 Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a pipe or tube. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, and translation vector 0.2465, 0.2465, 0.5. 2. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle (circle\\_1) with center at (0.1285, 0.1285) and radius 0.1285 on the XY plane. This forms loop\\_1 on face\\_1 of the 2D sketch. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.257. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using identity euler angles and translation vector 0, 0, 0. 6. Perform a cut extrusion with 0.0 depth in the positive normal direction and 1.0 depth in the opposite direction. This will result in a tapered end.</description>
